item.title: Woodcutting for delta (explaind) uses events
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“WaleedScape, post:10, topic:354523”]why do you keep using cases for the required level? you can just declare another int, like this:

} if (AxeId != -1) { if (c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[8]) < TreeLevel) {

thats my code, of course. and its neater
to check the level without using cases, which makes it look sloppy, you could have done this:

public int CheckAxe(Client c) { int Axe = c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]; if (Axe == 1351) { return 0; } else if (Axe == 1349) { return 1; } else if (Axe == 1353) { return 2; } else if (Axe == 1361) { return 3; } else if (Axe == 1355) { return 4; } else if (Axe == 1357) { return 5; } else if (Axe == 1359) { return 6; } else if (Axe == 6739) { return 7; }][/quote]
No. Switch statements are better than the shitty if-else statements you have shown.

OP: Your conventions are terribad. Your code can also be shortened. Anyways, I recommend you to use Blake’s EventExecutor.

Read full topic

item.title: Woodcutting for delta (explaind) uses events
item.dc:creator: @WaleedScape WaleedScape
item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

why do you keep using cases for the required level? you can just declare another int, like this:

} if (AxeId != -1) { if (c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[8]) < TreeLevel) {

thats my code, of course. and its neater
to check the level without using cases, which makes it look sloppy, you could have done this:

public int CheckAxe(Client c) { int Axe = c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]; if (Axe == 1351) { return 0; } else if (Axe == 1349) { return 1; } else if (Axe == 1353) { return 2; } else if (Axe == 1361) { return 3; } else if (Axe == 1355) { return 4; } else if (Axe == 1357) { return 5; } else if (Axe == 1359) { return 6; } else if (Axe == 6739) { return 7; }]

Read full topic

item.title: Woodcutting for delta (explaind) uses events
item.dc:creator: @destroynoobz destroynoobz
item.description:
@destroynoobz wrote:

okay so since my other 1 got locked cause it wasnt explain ill explain it with this realse

Okay this REQUIRED GRAHAMS EVENT MANGER!

Base - Delta
class modified- client, woodcutting

SOME OF YOU SAY THAT THIS ISNT GOOD AND THE OTHER ONE IS BETTER WELL THIS ISNT AMAZING THE ONE IM NOT REALESING IS VERY GOOD THE PROBLEM WITH THE ONE THE OTHER GUY REALSEAD IS IT USES PROCESS PROCESS ARE NO GOOD THATS WHY EVENT MANGERS WHERE MADE

Step 1. Remove anything to do with woodcutting

Step 2.
Make a new class and call it WoodCutting.java and stick it in there

[code]public class WoodCutting { //Made By: Andrew A.K.A Destroynoobz && Andrewert

		public int requiredLevel(int object){
			switch(object){
				case 1276://tree id
				case 1315:
				case 1282:
					return 1;//required level
				case 1281:
					return 15;
				case 1308:
					return 30;
				case 1307:
					return 45;
				case 1309:
					return 60;
				case 1306:
					return 75;
			}
				return 1;
		}
		
		public int requiredAxeLevel(int object){
			switch(cuttingLog){
				case 1351://axe id
				case 1349:
					return 1;//level to use axe
				case 1353:
					return 5;
				case 1361:
					return 10;
				case 1355:
					return 20;
				case 1357:
					return 30;
				case 1399:
					return 40;
				case 6739:
					return 60;
				}
					return 1;
			}
				
		public int logg(int object){
			switch(object){
				case 1276://tree id
				case 1315:
				case 1282:
					return 1511;//logg id
				case 1281:
					return 1521;
				case 1308:
					return 1519;
				case 1307:
					return 1517;
				case 1309:
					return 1515;
				case 1306:
					return 1513;
			}
				return 1;
		}
		
		
		public boolean hasAxe(int a) {
			Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[a];
			if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1351 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1349
				|| c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1353 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1355
				|| c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1357 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1359
				|| c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1361 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 6739) {
				return true;
			}
			return false;
		}
	
			public int[] trees = new int[100];
			public int[] treesTimer = new int[100];
			public int[] treeX = new int[100];
			public int[] treeY = new int[100];
			
			public int objectXT, objectYT, objectIDT, respawnTimeT;
			public int cuttingLog;
			public int axeId;
			
		public void preCut(int a, int objectX, int objectY, int objectID, int respawnTime){
			cuttingLog = axeId;
			Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[a];
			objectXT = objectX;
			objectYT = objectY;
			objectIDT = objectID;
			respawnTimeT = respawnTime;
			if(!hasAxe(c.playerId)){
				c.sM("You need a Axe to Woodcut!");
			if(c.playerLevel[8] < (requiredLevel(objectIDT)));
				c.sM("You need a level of" +(requiredLevel(objectIDT))+ "to cut this");
			if(c.playerLevel[8] < (requiredAxeLevel(objectIDT)));
				c.sM("You need a level of"+(requiredAxeLevel(objectIDT))+"to use this axe");
			} else {
				c.pEmote = 0x284;
				c.playerIsWoodCutting = true;
				c.woodcuttingEvent();
				c.woodcuttingEventTimer = 3;
			}
		}

		public void cut(int a){
			Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[a];
			c.sM("You cut some "+c.getItemName(logg(objectIDT))+".");
			c.addItem(logg(objectIDT), 1);
			c.addSkillXP(requiredLevel(objectIDT)*15, 8);
			c.pEmote = 0x284;
			c.updatePlayer();
				for(int i = 0; i < trees.length; i++){
					if(trees[i] == 0){
						trees[i] = objectIDT;
						treesTimer[i] = respawnTimeT;
						treeX[i] = objectXT;
						treeY[i] = objectYT;
						c.ReplaceObject(objectXT, objectYT, 1341 , 0, 10);
							return;
					}
				}
		}
	}[/code]

So Lets go over it

public int requiredLevel(int object){ switch(object){ case 1276://tree id case 1315: case 1282: return 1;//required level case 1281: return 15; case 1308: return 30; case 1307: return 45; case 1309: return 60; case 1306: return 75; } return 1; }
is for when you wana cut the tree so the case is the tree id and the return is the level required to use it

public int requiredAxeLevel(int object){ switch(cuttingLog){ case 1351://axe id case 1349: return 1;//level to use axe case 1353: return 5; case 1361: return 10; case 1355: return 20; case 1357: return 30; case 1399: return 40; case 6739: return 60; } return 1; }
is for the axe when you want to cut a logg your axe requires a certain level the case is the axe id the return is the level for the axe

public int logg(int object){ switch(object){ case 1276://tree id case 1315: case 1282: return 1511;//logg id case 1281: return 1521; case 1308: return 1519; case 1307: return 1517; case 1309: return 1515; case 1306: return 1513; } return 1; }
is saying when you cut the tree what you will recieve the case is the tree id the return is waht you recieve

public boolean hasAxe(int a) { Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[a]; if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1351 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1349 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1353 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1355 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1357 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1359 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 1361 || c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == 6739) { return true; } return false; } this is saying if you are wearing the axe it will cut if not nothing will happen

[code]public int[] trees = new int[100];
public int[] treesTimer = new int[100];
public int[] treeX = new int[100];
public int[] treeY = new int[100];

			public int objectXT, objectYT, objectIDT, respawnTimeT;
			public int cuttingLog;
			public int axeId;[/code]

this is the respawn timer and somethings that needed to be declared for it to work

public void preCut(int a, int objectX, int objectY, int objectID, int respawnTime){ cuttingLog = axeId; Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[a]; objectXT = objectX; objectYT = objectY; objectIDT = objectID; respawnTimeT = respawnTime; if(!hasAxe(c.playerId)){ c.sM("You need a Axe to Woodcut!"); if(c.playerLevel[8] < (requiredLevel(objectIDT))); c.sM("You need a level of" +(requiredLevel(objectIDT))+ "to cut this"); if(c.playerLevel[8] < (requiredAxeLevel(objectIDT))); c.sM("You need a level of"+(requiredAxeLevel(objectIDT))+"to use this axe"); } else { c.pEmote = 0x284; c.playerIsWoodCutting = true; c.woodcuttingEvent(); c.woodcuttingEventTimer = 3; }
this is for when you go to cut the tree it states all the requirements that you need to cut the tree like level,axe,levelofaxe if you do have all taht it will do the emote and cut the tree

public void cut(int a){ Client c = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[a]; c.sM("You cut some "+c.getItemName(logg(objectIDT))+"."); c.addItem(logg(objectIDT), 1); c.addSkillXP(requiredLevel(objectIDT)*15, 8); c.pEmote = 0x284; c.updatePlayer(); for(int i = 0; i < trees.length; i++){ if(trees[i] == 0){ trees[i] = objectIDT; treesTimer[i] = respawnTimeT; treeX[i] = objectXT; treeY[i] = objectYT; c.ReplaceObject(objectXT, objectYT, 1341 , 0, 10); return; } } }
this is statign when you are cutting the tree what will happen like give you skill exp add items send a message and replace the tree with the stump

now open Client.java and stick this shit in there

[code]public boolean playerIsWoodCutting;
public int woodcuttingEventTimer = 0;
public void woodcuttingEvent(){
EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
public void execute(EventContainer c) {
for(int i = 0; i < Server.WoodCutting.trees.length; i++){
if(Server.WoodCutting.treesTimer[i] > 0)
Server.WoodCutting.treesTimer[i]–;

						if(Server.WoodCutting.treesTimer[i] == 1){
							ReplaceObject(Server.WoodCutting.treeX[i], Server.WoodCutting.treeY[i], Server.WoodCutting.trees[i], 0, 10);
							Server.WoodCutting.trees[i] = 0;
							Server.WoodCutting.treesTimer[i] = 0;
							Server.WoodCutting.treeX[i] = 0;
							Server.WoodCutting.treeY[i] = 0;	
						}
					}	
					if(playerIsWoodCutting == true){
						if(woodcuttingEventTimer == 1){
							int test = Misc.random(Server.WoodCutting.requiredLevel(Server.WoodCutting.objectIDT)*5);
							//sM(""+test);
							if(playerLevel[8] > test){
								Server.WoodCutting.cut(playerId);
								playerIsWoodCutting = false;
								woodcuttingEventTimer = 0;
							} else {
								woodcuttingEventTimer = 3;
							}
						} else {
							woodcuttingEventTimer--;		
						}
					}
				}
			}, 600);
		}[/code] this part is so that it uses with events and gets the things from woodcutting.java and uses events

now search case 132
and add this

if (objectID == 1276 || objectID == 1315 || objectID == 1282 || objectID == 1281 || objectID == 1308 || objectID == 1307 || objectID == 1309 || objectID == 1306) { Server.WoodCutting.preCut(playerId, objectX, objectY, objectID, 40); }

this is for when you click on the tree the object id is the object id and then it gets the rest from woodcutting.java the precut

Read full topic
